The company MCD, -0.43% said same-store sales for the quarter ended Sept. 30 fell 2.2% from a year ago, but that beat the FactSet consensus of a 5.0% decline. U.S. same-store sales grew 4.6%, more than the FactSet consensus of 2.5% growth. The company said U.S. sales were positive throughout the quarter, boosted by âstrongâ average check growth from larger group orders. Separately, the company said it was raising its quarterly dividend to $1.29 a share from $1.25. The new dividend will be payable Dec. 15 to shareholders of record on Dec. 1.
